AddClientSubscription.document: This API is used to add a subscription for an MQTT client.
AddClientSubscription.name: This API is used to add a subscription for an MQTT client.

CreateAuthorizationPolicy.document: This API is used to create a performance test task for an MQTT instance.
CreateAuthorizationPolicy.name: Creates an authorization policy

CreateInstance.document: This API is used to purchase a new MQTT instance.
CreateInstance.name: Purchase an MQTT instance

CreateMessageEnrichmentRule.document: This API is used to create a message enrichment rule.
CreateMessageEnrichmentRule.name: Create message enrichment rule

CreateUser.document: This API is used to add an MQTT role.
CreateUser.name: Adds an MQTT role

DeleteAuthorizationPolicy.document: This API is used to delete policy rules.
DeleteAuthorizationPolicy.name: Delete an authorization policy

DeleteClientSubscription.document: This API is used to delete a subscription of an MQTT client.
DeleteClientSubscription.name: Delete a subscription for an MQTT client

DeleteInstance.document: This API is used to delete an MQTT instance.
DeleteInstance.name: This API is used to delete an MQTT instance.

DeleteMessageEnrichmentRule.document: This API is used to delete the message enrichment rule.
DeleteMessageEnrichmentRule.name: Delete message enrichment rule

DeleteTopic.document: This API is used to delete an MQTT topic.
DeleteTopic.name: This API is used to delete an MQTT topic.

DeleteUser.document: This API is used to delete an MQTT user.
DeleteUser.name: Delete an MQTT role

DescribeAuthorizationPolicies.document: This API is used to query authorization rules.
DescribeAuthorizationPolicies.name: Query an authorization policy

DescribeClientList.document: This API is used to query the MQTT client details.
DescribeClientList.name: Query the MQTT client list

DescribeInstance.document: This API is used to query instance information.
DescribeInstance.name: Query MQTT instance details

DescribeMessageByTopic.document: This API is used to query messages based on subscription.
DescribeMessageByTopic.name: Query messages based on subscription

DescribeMessageDetails.document: This API is used to query the MQTT message details.
DescribeMessageDetails.name: Query MQTT detailed information

DescribeMessageEnrichmentRules.document: This API is used to query message enrichment rules.
DescribeMessageEnrichmentRules.name: Query message enrichment rules

DescribeTopic.document: This API is used to query the MQTT topic details.
DescribeTopic.name: Query MQTT topic details

DescribeUserList.document:
This API is used to query the user list. Filter parameter usage instructions are as follows:.

This API is used to perform Username fuzzy search.
DescribeUserList.name: Query the MQTT user list

KickOutClient.document: This API is used to kick out a client.
KickOutClient.name: Kick out a client

ModifyAuthorizationPolicy.document: This API is used to modify policy rules. See the data plane authorization policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
ModifyAuthorizationPolicy.name: Modify an authorization policy

ModifyInstance.document: This API is used to modify instance attributes. Only running clusters can call this API to perform configuration change.
ModifyInstance.name: Modify MQTT instance attributes

ModifyMessageEnrichmentRule.document:
This API is used to modify message enrichment rules.
Note: All attributes of the current rule must be submitted, even if specific fields are not modified.
ModifyMessageEnrichmentRule.name: Modify message enrichment rule

ModifyUser.document: This API is used to modify an MQTT role.
ModifyUser.name: This API is used to modify an MQTT role.

UpdateAuthorizationPolicyPriority.document: This API is used to modify policy rule priority.
UpdateAuthorizationPolicyPriority.name: Update authorization policy priority

UpdateMessageEnrichmentRulePriority.document: This API is used to modify the priority for message enrichment rule.
UpdateMessageEnrichmentRulePriority.name: Update message enhancement rule priority

members.document: Policy rule ID.
members.name: Id

members.document: MQTT cluster ID.

members.document: Specifies the policy rule name.
members.name: PolicyName

members.document: Rule syntax version. currently only support 1. defaults to 1.
members.name: Version

members.document: Policy priority. a smaller priority ID indicates the policy takes effect with higher priority. see [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Priority

members.document:
Specifies the decision.
allow specifies permission for access requests from devices that match this policy.
deny: denies access requests to the device that override the policy.
Refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Effect

members.document:
Operation.
Specifies the connection.
Publishes an mqtt message.
Sub. specifies the subscription to mqtt messages.
Refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Actions

members.document: Resource. see the data plane authorization policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Resources

members.document: Specifies the device ID for connection. refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).

members.document: Condition - service quality. see the data plane authorization policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Qos

members.document:
Condition - message retention. refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
Indicates the match of retain messages.
2: indicates non-retain messages.
3: indicates matching retain and non-retain messages.
members.name: Retain

members.document: Specifies the remark with length not exceeding 128 characters.
members.name: Remark

members.document: Creation time. millisecond-level timestamp.

members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Policy name, which cannot be empty, contains 3 to 64 characters, and supports chinese, letters, digits, "-", and "_".
members.name: PolicyName

members.document: Policy version, defaults to 1. currently only support 1.
members.name: PolicyVersion

members.document: Policy priority. a smaller value indicates higher priority and must be unique. a smaller priority ID means the policy takes effect with higher priority. see [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Priority

members.document:
Specifies the decision.
allow specifies permission for access requests from devices that match this policy.
deny: denies access requests to the device that override the policy.
Refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Effect

members.document:
Operation, supports multiple selections separated by commas. see the data plane policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
Specifies the connection.
Specifies the publish action.
Sub. specifies the subscription.
members.name: Actions

members.document:
Condition - message retention. refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
Matches message retention.
Matches non-retention messages.
3. match retained and non-retained messages.
members.name: Retain

members.document:
Condition: specifies the service quality.
0: at most once.
Minimum once.
2: exactly once.
Refer to the [data plane authorization policy description](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).
members.name: Qos

members.document: Specifies the resource and subscription to match. supports configuration of multiple match rules, separated by commas. see the data plane authorization policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).

BASIC: basic edition.
PRO edition.
PLATINUM version.

members.document: Whether public network access is enabled. default false (disabled).
members.name: EnablePublic

members.document: Public network bandwidth (unit: Mbps). this field is mandatory and must be more than 0 when EnablePublic is True.
members.name: Bandwidth

members.document: Public network access allowlist. if not passed, it means deny all IP network access.
members.name: IpRules

members.document: Whether the instance is automatically renewed (0: no auto-renewal; 1: auto-renewal). this parameter is valid only when you purchase a prepaid cluster. default value: 1 (auto-renewal).
members.name: RenewFlag

members.document: Specifies the purchase duration (measurement unit: month). this parameter is valid only when you purchase a prepaid cluster. default: 1m (month). valid values: 1-12, 24, 36, 48, 60.
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document: Payment mode (0: postpaid; 1: prepaid). default: 0 (postpaid).

members.document:
Rule matching conditions in JSON format, Base64 encoding is required.
Creating a Billing Resource Order
{"clientId":"client-1","username":"client-1","topic":"home/room1"}
Specifies the Base64-encoded content.
eyJjbGllbnRJZCI6ImNsaWVudC0xIiwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJjbGllbnQtMSIsInRvcGljIjoiaG9tZS9yb29tMSJ9
members.name: Condition

members.document:
Specifies the action of rule execution in JSON format, which must be Base64 encoded.
Creating a Billing Resource Order
{"messageExpiryInterval":360,"responseTopic":"replies/devices/${clientid}","correlationData":"${traceid}","userProperty":[{"key":"trace-id","value":"${traceid}"}]}
Specifies the BASE64-encoded value.
eyJtZXNzYWdlRXhwaXJ5SW50ZXJ2YWwiOjM2MCwicmVzcG9uc2VUb3BpYyI6InJlcGxpZXMvZGV2aWNlcy8ke2NsaWVudGlkfSIsImNvcnJlbGF0aW9uRGF0YSI6IiR7dHJhY2VpZH0iLCJ1c2VyUHJvcGVydHkiOlt7ImtleSI6InRyYWNlLWlkIiwidmFsdWUiOiIke3RyYWNlaWR9In1dfQ==

members.document: Producer address.
members.name: ClientId

members.document: Topic
members.name: Qos

members.document: Specifies the source topic.
members.name: OriginTopic

members.document:
Content type (MQTT5).
Indicates the content type of the message payload using standard MIME type format. helps the receiver correctly parse and process the message content.
Specifies the example.
application/json: indicates the payload is data in json format.
Text/Plain: indicates the payload is plain text.
application/octet-stream: indicates the payload is binary data.
members.name: ContentType

members.document:
Payload format indicator (MQTT5).
Indicates the payload format, which is a boolean value. 0 means an unspecified format (binary), and 1 means a UTF-8 encoded string.
Specifies the example.
Valid values: 0 indicates the payload is binary data, such as images or audio.
Valid value 1: when the payload is UTF-8 encoded text, such as JSON string or XML.
members.name: PayloadFormatIndicator

members.document:
Message expiration interval (MQTT5).
Specifies the validity time (in seconds) of the specified message before it is discarded. if the message fails to reach the MQTT server before expiration, it will be discarded.
Specifies the example.
The value 60 indicates that the message is valid within 60 seconds after release. unreached messages will be dropped after expiry.
A value of 0 indicates the message never expires and remains permanently valid until received or the session ends.
members.name: MessageExpiryInterval

members.document:
Response topic (MQTT5).
Specifies a topic for the response message in request-response mode. the sender can specify which topic the recipient should send the response to.
Specifies the example.
Sender publishes a request to the topic devices/device1/commands and sets ResponseTopic to devices/device1/responses.
Specifies the topic where the response is published after the recipient processes the request.
members.name: ResponseTopic

members.document:
Associated data (MQTT5).
Specifies the identifier used to associate a request and response, usually a byte array. in request-response mode, the sender sets this value, and the recipient includes the same value in the response so that the sender can identify the corresponding request.
Specifies the example.
The sender generates a unique ID (such as a byte[] of UUID) as CorrelationData and adds it to the request message.
The recipient includes the same CorrelationData in the response message. the sender compares this value to match the response and the request.
members.name: CorrelationData

members.document:
Subscription identifier (MQTT5).
Specifies the unique identifier assigned to the subscription, used to identify a specific subscription of the client. when sending a message to the client, the server can include this identifier to help with client identification of the corresponding subscription.
Specifies the example.
The client subscribes to the topic devices/+/temperature and sets SubscriptionIdentifier to 123.
When the server sends a message of this topic to the client, the message will contain SubscriptionIdentifier: 123. the client can know which subscription the message is sent through based on this value.
members.name: SubscriptionIdentifier

Rule matching conditions, in JSON format, must be Base64-encoded. 
Specifies the client id, username, and topic. example: {"clientId":"client-1","username":"client-1","topic":"home/room1"}.
Specifies the Base64-encoded string "eyJjbGllbnRJZCI6ImNsaWVudC0xIiwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJjbGllbnQtMSIsInRvcGljIjoiaG9tZS9yb29tMSJ9".

members.document:
Specifies the action of rule execution in JSON format, which must be Base64 encoded.
 Creating a Billing Resource Order
{"messageExpiryInterval":360,"response Topic":"replies/devices/${clientid}","correlationData":"${traceid}","userProperty":[{"key":"trace-id","value":"${traceid}"},{"key":"data-source","value":"rule-engine"}]}
Specifies the BASE64-encoded string "eyJtZXNzYWdlRXhwaXJ5SW50ZXJ2YWwiOjM2MCwicmVzcG9uc2UgVG9waWMiOiJyZXBsaWVzL2RldmljZXMvJHtjbGllbnRpZH0iLCJjb3JyZWxhdGlvbkRhdGEiOiIke3RyYWNlaWR9IiwidXNlclByb3BlcnR5IjpbeyJrZXkiOiJ0cmFjZS1pZCIsInZhbHVlIjoiJHt0cmFjZWlkfSJ9LHsia2V5IjoiZGF0YS1zb3VyY2UiLCJ2YWx1ZSI6InJ1bGUtZW5naW5lIn1dfQ==".

Specifies the decision.
allow. specifies the permission.

Operation, supports multiple selections separated by commas. see the data plane policy description (https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/1778/109715?from_cn_redirect=1).

Specifies the publish action.

Specifies the configuration specification to be changed.
Basic version and professional edition clusters cannot be upgraded to platinum version specifications. platinum edition clusters cannot be downgraded to basic version and enhanced specifications.
